channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for OH
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for OH

item.title: Report E-2025060295
item.description:
Report E-2025060295

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-22T01:13:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-06-13
  • City: WILMINGTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 15000
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: On June 13, 2025, one (1) 3,000-pound tote of sulfuric acid was damaged by an explosion inside the tote and released approximately two hundred (200) gallons of product to the trailer interior and terminal yard. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from EnviroServe (ES) to remediate the site. ES personnel deployed soda ash to the trailer interior, pavement and tires of nearby trailers. All sulfuric acid impacted material was collected and containerized into fifteen (15) 55-gallon drums and eleven (11) 35-gallon drums for future terminal disposal.
